nodes.long_description:
ENGAGE is a next generation communications platform. It empowers educators, companies and event planners to host meetings, presentations, classes and events with people across the world. 

Using the platform, virtual reality training and experiences can be created in minutes. The tools are very easy to use and require no technical expertise. You can choose to host your virtual reality sessions live, or record and save them for others to experience later. A wide variety of effective and immersive virtual experiences can be created with an extensive library of virtual objects, effects and virtual locations available via the platform.

You can host virtual events, stream in media or simply explore user generated content the possibilities are endless. 

ENGAGE | Communicate. Teach. Learn.
nodes.short_description: ENGAGE is a next generation communications platform. It empowers educators, companies and event planners to host meetings, presentations, classes and events with people across the world.

nodes.change_log:
Important: To update to the latest version of ENGAGE, your headset’s firmware must be v69 or later. If you open ENGAGE and do not see v3.10.1 in the lower-right corner of the log-in page, please update your headset’s firmware.

NEW 
- Added new session settings to give non-host users permission to change the location and load content. 

IMPROVED
- Filtered AI character responses to remove the # symbol and prevent unintended shouting. 

FIXED
- Fixed an issue that could cause a location to appear as only a black screen when a user joined a session. 
- Fixed an issue that prevented users from joining a passworded persistent session.  
- Fixed an issue that caused standard sessions to remain visible in the public listing after all users left. 
- Fixed an issue that could cause an outfit override to be applied outside of the designated region. 
- Fixed an issue that could cause a user's avatar to not be visible in a session. 
- Fixed the haptic feedback that occurs when two avatar hands collide. 
- Fixed image uploads for the My Face service.
- Fixed an issue that prevented users on VR devices from selecting buttons in content. 
- Fixed an issue that could cause some objects in a piece of content to not appear for some users.

NEW
- Enabled the use of both hand controllers to interact with menus.
- Enabled VR users to type on the virtual keyboard by tapping keys with their hand controllers.
- Implemented quick links to speed up access to sessions.
- Added an option to the Invite panel in a session for users to copy a quick link to the session.
- Added new languages for voice recognition when interacting with AI characters.
- Added processing to remove special characters included in text returned by AI services to prevent them from being verbalized.
- Added a subfolder named AI-Generated to the Images folder, where images generated by AI services will be saved.
- Added an option for users to empty their recycle bin and permanently delete the files.
- Added support for the Immersive Learning Platform (ILP) as an MDM for Meta Quest devices.
- Updated to Unity 2022.3.
- Replaced the teleport sit marker with a higher resolution, language-neutral version, and moved the ghost seat closer to the actual seat position.
- Removed the head-tracking gaze cursor that appeared when hand tracking was lost.
- Prevented LITE users from being made co-hosts in a session, to improve security.
- Fixed event creation by PLUS users to prevent the overbooking warning from appearing unnecessarily.
- Ensured that midnight appears as 00:00 instead of 24:00 in event listings.
- Fixed an issue with scalable events so that if a user leaves and rejoins an event, they join the first instance that has capacity.
- Fixed an issue in scalable events that caused the user count on the in-session menu to be incorrect.
- Fixed an issue that could cause user input to stop registering in the personal web browser on Quest headsets.
- Fixed muting on VR headsets to ensure that if a user was unmuted before they entered away mode, they are unmuted when they return.
- Fixed the option to mute LITE users so that non-LITE users aren't also affected.
- Fixed the notification when a host requests that a user unmutes their microphone.
- Fixed the ability to place the text cursor (caret) at a specific position in a text field when using hand controllers.
- Fixed an issue that prevented users from downloading camera images after they uploaded them to Cloud File Manager.
- Fixed the display of feedback to a user if they attempt to play a YouTube video through an invalid URL.
- Fixed an issue that could cause the visibility icons to not be shown in the Content Editor curves view.

NEW
- Launched the School of AI - where users can talk with 20 different historical figures whose lives spanned from the ancient world to the US civil rights era. As part of the launch, all ENGAGE users will have access to the School of AI during the month of October. To arrange access after this time, please contact sales.
- Replaced the keyboard that appears for VR users with a version that has an improved layouts for each language, custom layouts for specific input types, easier access to common keys and commands, and can be repositioned in 3D space.
- Set events that are associated with a persistent session to automatically start at the designated time. This removes the need for an event organizer to manually start the event. The event will also automatically be removed from the event list at the designated end time.
- Added an option for hosts to set all users who are in a session, or join later, to appear as basic avatars.
- Updated session creation so that all sessions created by a member of an Enterprise group are owned by an Enterprise group. This enables Enterprise features and services to be available in standard Sessions.
- Added the ability to replace the public list of outfit options with a custom collection for a specific Enterprise group.


IMPROVED
- Increased the maximum resolution for YouTube videos to 1080p in standard locations and 4k in UHD locations.
- Implemented progressive download of outfit thumbnails to reduce the possibility that a slow connection will cause the application to become unresponsive.
- Replaced gender labels with body shape options in the avatar editor.
- Implemented a more efficient process to distribute audio returned by text-to-speech services. For example, when users interact with an AI agent.
- Set persistent sessions to reset their location to the ENGAGE Hub if there is an error loading the current location. 
- Updated the location anchor to appear in front of a user when they choose to reset their anchor's placement.
- Standardized the presentation of dates and times shown in the application.
- Improved consistency in the sequence of dialogs that a user may see when they join a plaza from the ENGAGE LINK map.


FIXED
- Fixed the display of 2D 360 YouTube videos.
- Fixed the display of 3D 360 videos on Android-based devices, which includes most standalone VR headsets.
- Fixed an issue that caused chroma key videos to display in low resolution on VR devices.
- Fixed an issue that caused users who joined a session after a YouTube video was muted to still hear the audio.
- Fixed support for YouTube videos loaded through a /live or /short URL.
- Fixed an issue that could cause some users in a session to not hear an AI character's responses.
- Fixed an issue that caused Remember Me settings to be lost when a user lost their network connection during use of the application.
- Fixed an issue that could prevent a user from changing their height when they used imperial units.
- Fixed an issue that could cause an avatar to appear in the wrong pose and position when it first loads in a session.
- Fixed an issue that caused a height entered as 5 ft. to be displayed as 4 ft. 12 in.
- Fixed an issue when a user walked through a metatraversal portal that caused their avatar to continue moving while the Meta menu was open.
- Fixed an issue that caused the attendees and interested counts to show as zero when events were viewed on the Attending or Interested tabs of the Events page.
- Fixed an issue that could cause a user's microphone to cut out if they were recording and had an unstable network connection.
- Fixed an issue that could cause a warning about recording more than five users to appear when less than five users were selected.
- Fixed an issue that could cause host and microphone icons to be incorrectly positioned within a user's nameplate.
- Fixed the button to leave the mixed reality room and set up room space that appears when a user s device isn't fully set up to use mixed reality.
- Fixed an issue that could prevent a user from being able to log in when their device used the Hijri calendar.
- Fixed the tooltip text on the session creation screen.
- Fixed an issue that caused the in-session microphone icon's visibility to be turned off after a change in location.
